briefTitle: Study to Evaluate Psoriasis Severity and Its Psychosocial Impact Using the Simplified Psoriasis Index (SPI), as Well as Long-term Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Secukinumab Administered Subcutaneously in Patients With Moderate to Severe Psoriasis
officialTitle: A 52-week (Plus Extension Until Commercialization), Single-arm Study to Evaluate Psoriasis Severity and Its Psychosocial Impact Using the Simplified Psoriasis Index (SPI) at 16 Weeks, as Well as Long-term Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy of Secukinumab Administered Subcutaneously in Participants Suffering From Moderate to Severe Psoriasis
summary: Evaluate psoriasis severity and its psychosocial impact using a novel Patient Reported Outcome (the Simplified Psoriasis Index SPI) at 16 weeks, as well as long-term safety, tolerability and efficacy of secukinumab administered subcutaneously during 52 weeks (plus extension) in patients with moderate to severe psoriasis.

primaryOutcome.measure: proSPI (s) at Week 16 Compared to Baseline
